text: you
today I'm making yet another in my line
of nostalgic desserts it's a chocolate
banana pudding I'm making a chocolate
custard layering it with chocolate wafer
cookies and thinly sliced banana for the
custard all you need to do is bring two
cups of heavy cream to a boil and then
add five ounces of semi-sweet chocolate
chopped remove from the heat add two
tablespoons of confectioner's sugar and
then whisk til everything melts together
won't take very long and that's your
whole custard the chocolate will really
just thicken the heavy cream there's no
need for eggs or any other ingredients
like that you can see that it melts
really quickly and once it's melted you
just want to let it cool completely so
cool it to room temperature before you
proceed with your recipe when the
chocolate mixture is completely cool but
not like cold because then it'll set
assemble the rest of your pudding you're
going to need four bananas total three
of them you're going to slice lengthwise
and then half of one you're going to
slice in two rounds for the top your
bananas should be right but not like
mushy ripe not like you would use for
banana bread just make nice long slices
along your bananas into sort of planks
see like that you might end up with a
couple of little ends you can eat those
because bananas are very its next set
those aside for a second have a 2 quart
baking dish into the baking dish add
half of your chocolate mixture and then
you're going to need a total of 26
chocolate wafer cookies layer 13 cookies
on top of your chocolate mixture and
then top with your lengthwise sliced
bananas
this would be really really good in a
pie crust too if you wanted to you could
make a pie crust out of the chocolate
wafers and then fill it with the layers
of the custard and the end of the
cookies and man that would be really
good then top with 13 more cookies you
need a total of 26 and then finish with
the remaining chocolate mixture the
chocolate mixture will absorb into those
cookies making them soften which will
aid in the amazingness factor of this
dessert you'll have the creamy pudding
the luscious bananas and then a little
soft cakey layer from the cookies that
have absorbed the chocolate mixture
cookies need to be covered or they won't
soften so make sure that they are you
can press down on them a little bit
shake your pan for even distribution and
then refrigerate this at least two hours
and up to overnight until everything has
sort of melted together and the cookies
have softened slightly almost ready to
serve you just need to garnish with a
little bit more banana that way people
get an idea what's on the inside
thinly slice little rounds I mean
honestly you can do it however you want
and now it actually is ready to serve
spoon some up the chocolate and the
cream set together the chocolate hardens
as it cools and creates a kind of soft
custard everything comes together so
nicely in this dessert and it couldn't
be easier
you
